newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shangdong Pharm seen in HK$200-300 mln IPO - sources.
newsitem.headline: Shangdong Pharm seen in HK$200-300 mln IPO - sources.

text.p: China state-owned medicine manufacturer Shangdong Xinhua Pharmaceutical Co is expected to raise HK$200-HK$300 million through an H-share listing in Hong Kong, market sources said on Monday.

Sources said the company is expected to issue about 145 million H-shares at a price of about eight times its prospective price to earnings multiple. Proceeds raised are expected to be used to repay debt and to expand production capacity.
H-shares are Hong Kong-listed shares issued by China incorporated companies.
One market source noted Shangdong Xinhua has a long term contract to supply products to Coca-Cola Co's production lines in China.

"Shangdong Xinhua is one of the approved caffeine suppliers (of Coca-Cola) in China," B.C. Lo, vice president and director of external affairs of Coca-Cola China Ltd, told Reuters on Monday. Lo declined to give further comment.
Sources said Coca-Cola has less than 10 caffeine suppliers in China.
Shangdong Xinhua is expected to arrange a trip for analysts to visit its manufacturing facilities in China by the end of this week, sources said.
The listing promotion is expected to kick off in mid-December, and dealing in shares is expected later in the month, they said.
Sources said Nomura International is expected to be the sponsor of the issue. Nomura officials declined to comment.
Shangdong Xinhua is expected to be the last Chinese enterprise to seek a H-share listing in Hong Kong in 1996.
